intro: Ophthalmophyllum australe, commonly known as the Australian eyeplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, giving it a delicate appearance. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Ophthalmophyllum australe is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
